extendedIngredients.name: butternut squash
extendedIngredients.original: 1 large butternut squash, (about 2 1/4 pounds), peeled and cubed

extendedIngredients.originalName: large butternut squash, (about , peeled and cubed

extendedIngredients.name: leek
extendedIngredients.original: 1 large leek, washed well and chopped (about 1 cup)

extendedIngredients.originalName: large leek, washed well and chopped (about

extendedIngredients.name: rosemary
extendedIngredients.original: 1 spring of rosemary, leaves removed, chopped
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 spring of rosemary, leaves removed, chopped
extendedIngredients.originalName: spring of rosemary, leaves removed, chopped

extendedIngredients.name: sherry
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup sherry or dry white wine
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup sherry or dry white wine

extendedIngredients.name: vegetable broth
extendedIngredients.original: 3 cups fat-free, chicken broth or low-sodium vegetable broth
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 cups fat-free, chicken broth or low-sodium vegetable broth
extendedIngredients.originalName: fat-free, chicken broth or low-sodium vegetable broth

title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup
instructions: Preheat oven to 400° F.  In a large bowl, mix squash with rosemary, salt, and pepper.  Line a large cook sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil and coat with a thin layer of cooking spray.  Spread out the squash and coat the top with another thin layer of cooking spray. Bake 45 to 50 minutes until it is fork tender (This step can be done the night before. Once the squash has cooled, store in the fridge overnight).In a large stockpot, heat the butter over medium heat and add the leeks. Continue to sauté the leeks, stirring occasionally until they become translucent, about 5to 6 minutes.  Increase the heat to high and add the squash, broth, and sherry or wine.  After the mixture comes to a boil, immediately reduce the heat to low and simmer 20 to 25 minutes until the squash begins to break apart.  Blend until smooth with an immersion blender or in a food processor.Heat a small skillet over high heat.  Coat with cooking spray and add the sage. Cook about 1 minute, stirring constantly, until the leaves turn dark green and become crispy.  Garnish with sage and top with sour cream.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400° F.  In a large bowl, mix squash with rosemary, salt, and pepper.  Line a large cook sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil and coat with a thin layer of cooking spray.
Spread out the squash and coat the top with another thin layer of cooking spray.

Bake 45 to 50 minutes until it is fork tender (This step can be done the night before. Once the squash has cooled, store in the fridge overnight).In a large stockpot, heat the butter over medium heat and add the leeks. Continue to sauté the leeks, stirring occasionally until they become translucent, about 5to 6 minutes.  Increase the heat to high and add the squash, broth, and sherry or wine.  After the mixture comes to a boil, immediately reduce the heat to low and simmer 20 to 25 minutes until the squash begins to break apart.  Blend until smooth with an immersion blender or in a food processor.
Heat a small skillet over high heat.  Coat with cooking spray and add the sage. Cook about 1 minute, stirring constantly, until the leaves turn dark green and become crispy.
Garnish with sage and top with sour cream.
